intro: Marsdenia yaungpiensis, commonly known as the Yungpien Marsdenia, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
